alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 08 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Rounds of showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain will continue to impact the region through this evening. Soaking rain will effect all areas, with the highest rainfall amounts focused along and southeast of the mountains. High rainfall rates will support rapid runoff and flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Androscoggin, Central Interior Cumberland, Coastal Cumberland, Coastal Waldo, Coastal York, Interior Waldo, Interior York, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln and Sagadahoc. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Coastal Rockingham, Eastern Hillsborough, Interior Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A complex storm system will bring multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms into this evening. The focus for the heaviest rainfall will be from the foothills into the Midcoast. Repeating showers with heavy rainfall will likely lead to excessive runoff and flash flooding. Locally considerable flooding impacts are possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. If camping near a stream or river in the watch area you should use this time to move belongings to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Strafford
